name: Bernhard Rinner
content: Bernhard Rinner – Professor, Pervasive Computing Research Posts Multidrone mission specification and execution Minimizing idleness in multi-robot patrolling Multidrone flight demonstration Multidrone constellation changes Privacy-protection research in 3sat science show nano Persistent surveillance with multiple robots 1 2 Next » News Digitalization award to Daniel Bugelnig PhD defense Rockson Agyeman Two journal papers published in December 2024 Best Performer award to Daniel Bugelnig Teaching award to Rockson Agyeman IEEE ASI webinar 1 2 3 … 7 Next » About Bernhard Rinner is professor at the University of Klagenfurt where he is heading the Pervasive Computing group. He is deputy head of the Institute of Networked and Embedded Systems and vice dean of the Faculty of Technical Sciences. Bernhard Rinner and his team work on the analysis, design and evaluation of pervasive networked embedded systems. Ongoing research includes coordination, optimization, self-organization and privacy-protection in networks – composed of sensors, cameras and drones.
